1:
Give the king your righteous decrees, God,
\q your righteousness to the king's son.
\q
2:
May he judge your people with righteousness
\q and your poor with justice.
\q
3:
May the mountains produce peace for the people;
\q may the hills produce righteousness.
4:
May he judge the poor of the people;
\q may he save the children of the needy
\q and break in pieces the oppressor.
\q
5:
May they honor you while the sun endures,
\q and as long as the moon lasts throughout all generations.
6:
May he come down like rain on the mown grass,
\q like showers that water the earth.
\q
7:
May the righteous flourish in his days,
\q and may there be an abundance of peace till the moon is no more.
8:
May he have dominion from sea to sea,
\q and from the River to the ends of the earth.
\q
10:
May the kings of Tarshish and of the islands render tribute;
\q may the kings of Sheba and Seba offer gifts.
12:
For he helps the needy person who cries out
\q and the poor person who has no other helper.
13:
He has pity on the poor and needy,
\q and he saves the lives of needy people.
\q
14:
He redeems their lives from oppression and violence,
\q and their blood is precious in his sight.
15:
May he live! May the gold of Sheba be given to him.
\q May people always pray for him;
\q may God bless him all day long.
\q
18:
May Yahweh God, the God of Israel, be blessed,
\q who alone does wonderful things.
\q
19:
May his glorious name be blessed forever,
\q and may the whole earth be filled with his glory.
\q Amen and Amen.
\q
20: The prayers of David son of Jesse are finished.
